alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Guilford; Lee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 6:05PM EDT until July 01 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Alamance, Chatham, Guilford, Lee and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 605 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Asheboro, Randleman, Pittsboro, Siler City, Goldston, Pleasant Garden, Liberty, Ramseur, Franklinville, Staley, Hasty, Snow Camp, Coleridge, Bynum, Climax, Fearrington, Randleman Regional Reservior Marina, Seaforth Boat Dock, Jordan Lake State Rec Area and Jordan Lake. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Hwy 501 at Deep River and Patterson Creek and North Plank Rd at Deep River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
